required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Femoral Artery Crossover Rates in 1000 Consecutive Radial Cath Labs Procedures.
clinical_study.official_title: Femoral Artery Crossover Rates of 1000 Consecutive Radial (or Ulnar) Artery Procedures in the Cardiac Cath Lab for Diagnostic Cardiac Catheterizations and/or Percutaneous Coronary Interventions

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of Crossover rates of Radial Cardiac Catheterizations and/or PCIs into femoral vs published literature

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective review of 1000 consecutive Radial or Ulnar Cardiac Catheterizations and/or Percutaneous Coronary Interventions performed in our Institute by one single operator could provide us with the cross over rates to femoral interventions. In this manner these rates could be compared to the published rates of other institutions benchmarking our techniques with the outcomes for such interventions.

primary_outcome.measure: Crossover rate from Radial to Femoral access
primary_outcome.description: How often do you start a Cath on the Radial Artery and for any reason, have to switch to Femoral Artery.

study_pop.textblock: 1000 Consecutive Patients who underwent Radial (or Ulnar) Artery Procedures in the Cardiac Cath Lab for Diagnostic Cardiac Catheterizations and/or Percutaneous Coronary Interventions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients coming to the emergency room requiring Diagnostic Cardiac Catheterizations and/or Percutaneous Coronary Interventions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac Tamponade
- Cardiogenic Shock
